intro: Aylostera brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aylostera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink or white. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Aylostera brachyantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
